import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns

import missingno as msno

plt.style.use('seaborn')
sns.set(font_scale=2.5)

%matplotlib inline

source.931b254f:
f, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(18,8))

df_train['Survived'].value_counts().plot.pie(explode=[0, 0.1], autopct = '%1.1f%%',\
                                            ax=ax[0], shadow=True)
ax[0].set_title('Pie plot - Survived')
ax[0].set_ylabel('')
sns.countplot('Survived', data=df_train, ax=ax[1])
ax[1].set_title('Count plot - Survived')

plt.show()
source.106b139a:
y_position = 1.02
f, ax = plt.subplots(1,2,figsize=(18,8))

df_train["Pclass"].value_counts().plot.bar(ax=ax[0])
ax[0].set_title("Number of passengers by Pclass", y=y_position)
ax[0].set_ylabel("Count")

sns.countplot('Pclass', hue='Survived', data=df_train, ax=ax[1])
ax[1].set_title('Pclass: Survived vs Dead', y=y_position)
source.92a35691:
f, ax = plt.subplots(1,2,figsize=(18,8))
df_train[['Sex', 'Survived']].groupby(["Sex"], as_index=True).mean().plot.bar(ax=ax[0])
ax[0].set_title("Survived vs Sex")

sns.countplot('Sex', hue='Survived', data=df_train, ax=ax[1])
ax[1].set_title('Sex: Survived vs Dead')
plt.show()
source.d1e87f7c:
fig, ax = plt.subplots(1,1,figsize=(9,5))
sns.kdeplot(df_train[df_train['Survived'] == 1]['Age'], label='Survived == 1')
sns.kdeplot(df_train[df_train['Survived'] == 0]['Age'], label='Survived == 0')

plt.legend()

- Higher class, higher survival rate regardless of sex.

### General procedures
1. Check datasets whether they have missing data.
2. Exploratory data analysis - see individual features and check correlatio between features. 
3. Feagure engineering - including one-hot encoding, dividing into classes, dividing into intervals, dealing with text data
4. Make model - make model using sklearn
5. Model training and prediction 
6. Model evaluation
